Sin√©ad Burke is on a mission to make the fashion world more inclusive. ‚ÄúI think often we underestimate how much we matter, both to the people around us and to the world,‚Äù says Sin√©ad. ‚ÄúThe world would not be the same without us. There would be a void, be it big or small. And I think often, we don't think we have an impact. But each of us really, truly does.‚Äù‚Å£ ‚Å£
In honor of National Bullying Prevention month, we‚Äôve partnered with @teenvogue to share stories of #Advocates who are taking a stand against bullying and sparking positive global change. ‚ú® Learn more about Sin√©ad on IGTV now.

Meet Sin√©ad Burke (@thesineadburke). Sin√©ad has achondroplasia, a common form of dwarfism, and is using her disability to shine light on the need for more inclusivity in the world of fashion. ‚Å£
üë¢‚ú®üëú ‚Å£
‚ÄúI constantly ask the question, ‚ÄòWho‚Äôs not in the room?‚Äô And then my work is to make sure that I can answer that question and bring those people into the room, because I think that‚Äôs how we gain true progress,‚Äù says Sin√©ad. ‚ÄúI look at my role as an advocate for amplifying different types of voices.‚Äù üíï ‚Å£

‚ÄúMy mission is to celebrate the richness and diversity of cultures within the African diaspora,‚Äù says artist Adeyemi Adegbesan (@yung.yemi), who designed a face filter for Afropunk (@afropunk) this year.‚Å£
‚Å£
‚ÄúGoing all the way back to my childhood, my own personal journey of trying to find out more about my Nigerian heritage has always been a source of inspiration for me and that just spread to an interest in other African cultures and histories, and wanting to know more about black culture around the world,‚Äù says Adeyemi, who lives in Canada. ‚ÄúWhen you look at my work, it‚Äôs kind of like a synthesis of all of the things that I‚Äôm learning and being inspired by.‚Äù #ShareBlackStories‚Å£
‚Å£
Check out @design to learn more about Adeyemi‚Äôs art and see more stories about design from around the world.‚Å£

I want to show everyone that you really can be whatever you want, and I hope to inspire those who are struggling with that,‚Äù she says.‚Å£

Mother and son duo Pattharapol (aka Peepy) and Lee Puengboonpra (@peepy_and_mother_lee) love dressing up. ‚ÄúIt is a way that we can relax, express our creativity, mix and match items that we love,‚Äù says Peepy. ‚ÄúWhen it comes to taste, we share ideas.
